chargeHist.descr: Transfer Encumbered Property (Value Exceeds $10,000 but does not Exceed $100,000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruth E. Canapa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Transfer Encumbered Property (Value Exceeds $10,000 but does not Exceed $100,000), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.84(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Stayed and Imposed sentence on Ct 4 in this same case

Sentence is imposed and stayed, if imposed  the conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.
Concurrent with: Stayed and imposed sentence on Ct 4 in this same case

Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation in Ct 4 of this same case as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: The bond of $1000.00 is applied.  Remaining restitution to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  The State has 30 days to review the restitution and ask for a restitution hearing.

Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant is to pursue employment as directed by the agent, it is at the agent's discretion of defendant's ability to work.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request
Defendant is to attend victim/offender counseling if the victims wish to do such counseling.

The defendant shall have no contact with Frank & LeeNor Hannan-Rock  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way unless the victims consent to it and the agent agrees.  
Defendant is not to give any monetary gifts without the approval of the agent. 
If the defendant is contacted on the Internet from anybody asking for money, she is to notify the agent right away.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
The defendant is to write a letter of apology to the victim's, which she will give to her agent and agent needs to approve it.

timeConds.notes: Defendant has 60 days to report to jail.  Defendant may serve her sentence in Eau Claire County.  Defendant needs to serve the first 30 days in the jail and the next 30 days may be served on electronic monitoring.  Jail sentence is on Ct 1 only.
